description: The haddock simply cooked with chilli, coriander and lemongrass in this flavoursome, healthy dish, served with coconut rice. This meal is low calorie and provides 403 kcal, 34.4g protein, 57.5g carbohydrate (of which 0.4g sugars), 2.2g fat (of which 0.9g saturates), 0.1g fibre and 0.3g salt per portion.

default: 1 lime, sliced, plus extra lime halves to serve
2 lemongrass stalks, 1 roughly chopped and 1 bashed
2 fresh or dried kaffir lime leaves

steps: Cut 4 pieces of nonstick baking paper, each 30cm/12in square. Put a haddock fillet in the centre of each piece and arrange some of the coriander, chilli, shallot, lime and chopped lemongrass stalk evenly over each. Wrap them up into neat parcels. Transfer the parcels to a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.

Put the rice in a lidded pan, cover with water and bring to the boil. Simmer with the lid on for 10 minutes, or until the rice is soft. When the rice is cooked and the water absorbed, stir in the coconut milk.
Serve with the rice alongside the haddock parcels, with some extra lime halves.
title: Haddock parcels and coconut rice
